article.Heading: Rail Budget 2016: LIC to fund Rs 1.5 lk crore over next 5 years, says Prabhu
article.Summary: Prabhu said he prefers to change the term completion to commissioning as it appears more practical and accordingly laid out a target to commission 9 km per day of broad guage to increase to 13 km per day in FY19.
article.Body:
We plan to tap rupee bond market overseas to raise funds, said Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu, while presenting his second Railway Budget on Thursday.

Prabhu said the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has agreed to fund Rs 1.5 lakh crore over next 5 years. This is expected to ease pressure on the debt market. 

The goods earnings target for FY17 has been fixed at Rs 1.18 lakh crore, he said.

Prabhu said he prefers to change the term completion to commissioning as it appears more practical and accordingly laid out a target to commission 9 km per day of broad guage in FY18 to increase to 13 km per day in FY19.

Pension spending for the huge employee base of the railways has been proposed at Rs 45,500 crore, he said.

He highlighted that dedicated freight corridors (DFCs) are gaining momentum and proposed to set up 2 DFCs by 2019, he said.

Margao and Hazira Ports are likely to be set up In FY17 via PPP model, he said.
